text.textblock: Fremont Group, Inc._Control Exemption_Yellowstone Trucking, Inc.

summary.textblock: The Commission exempts Fremont Group, Inc., which indirectly controls a 10.5-mile rail line, from the requirements of 49 U.S.C. 11343-44 for the reacquisition from a voting trust of indirect control of Yellowstone Trucking, Inc., a motor carrier subject to Commission regulation.

date.textblock: This exemption will be effective on March 10, 1994. Petitions to stay must be filed by February 18, 1994. Petitions to reopen must be filed by February 28, 1994.

address.textblock: Send pleadings, referring to Finance Docket No. 32415 to: (1) Office of the Secretary, Case Control Branch, Interstate Commerce Commission, Washington, DC 20423; and (2) Petitioner's representative: Karl Morell, suite 210, 919 Eighteenth Street NW., Washington, DC 20006.

further.textblock: Richard B. Felder (202) 927-5610. (TDD for hearing impaired: (202) 927-5721.)

supplem.textblock: Additional information is contained in the Commission's decision. To purchase a copy of the full decision, write, call, or pick up from: Dynamic Concepts, Inc., room 2229, Interstate Commerce Commission Building, Washington, DC 20423. Telephone: (202) 289-4357/4359. (Assistance for the hearing impaired is available through TDD services (202) 927-5721.)
By the Commission, Chairman McDonald, Vice Chairman Phillips, Commissioners Simmons and Philbin.
